website_summaries.verdict: A coconut-based powder creamer with a lightly sweet flavor.
pros: This formula is free of gluten and soy
Compliant with vegan, paleo, and keto diets
The sweet flavor comes from a low glycemic dried coconut tree blossom nectar, which is perfect for people who want to avoid refined sugars
It also includes Aquamin, a mineral that may help relieve gut inflammation
Users enjoy the creamy flavor and texture
cons: Can clump when first added to hot drinks, so many users stir with a spoon or a blender

customer_reviews.title: This product is absolutely perfect and delicious
customer_reviews.text: This product is absolutely perfect and delicious. It will not give you the look and exact taste of dairy cream, half and half or one of the chemical creamers like coffee mate. However, it takes the edge off the black coffee taste and gives you a smooth luscious texture and taste. I have been on a quest for a healthy dairy and soy free creamer and I finally found it. Give it a chance! Yes it clumps at first but all you have to do is mix it up with your spoon. It blends beautifully without the blender or mixer. This product is delicious and anti inflammatory! It doesn't get better than that.
customer_reviews.author: jerseyman

customer_reviews.title: Great idea here but the execution of it
customer_reviews.text: Great idea here but the execution of it, I personally didn’t care for. It only changed the flavor of the coffee slightly, to a coconut tinted one. It didn’t get creamier. I tried more and more. Had to end up using additional regular creamer. Then I was using it with full strength creamer just to use it up. I didn’t think it was good at all and kind of a waste of money for me. Was hoping it would be good. Also, it stains if spilled, the oil leaves a mark. You’ll have to pretreat if you spill on your clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR HARD EARNED DOLLAR ON THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: "Creamer" it's not. And it's not supposed to be. Creamer "substitute" it is but only if you use 3 to 4 HEAPING tsp to your 8 - 10 oz of coffee. I purchased to try as a dairy substitute as I am lactose intolerant. It will be back to Lactaid for me! This does have a smooth coconut taste if you like that sort of thing. However, dollar vs. amount that must be used just doesn't add up!
customer_reviews.author: Dane

customer_reviews.title: I love it! It's much healthier than cream/milk
customer_reviews.text: I love it! It's much healthier than cream/milk! I put it in a blender with coffee and it's so smooth and frothy! I use to put suger in my coffee, no need with this. I do add a sprinkle of cinnamon some times. I strongly recommend this for healthier tasting coffee! KCH
customer_reviews.author: Zoe Girl

customer_reviews.title: Yummy healthy creamer
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today and couldn't wait to try it. It's pretty tasty and blends easily. It doesn't exactly compare to the taste of my coffee mate but I gave that up because of being so unhealthy. I'm a powder creamer junkie. I had to use alot of this creamer to lighten my coffee which means it would be pretty pricey to use every day for someone like me who likes a little coffee with my creamer.
customer_reviews.author: MElliott

customer_reviews.title: love the taste, but made me ill
customer_reviews.text: The product was as expected. Worked great in my coffee, loved the taste, but over a few days I started feeling ill after each time I used it. Not sure why, but as soon as I stopped using it and drank my coffee without it, I was fine. Used it one more time and was ill again. I think it may be the type of sugar used in it. Have used their other Laird creamers with no problems. I just found out I can't return any of the 4 one pound bags I got and am bummed out.... I'd prefer to return these unopened for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: sky

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I might as well put a teaspoon of coconut oil or coconut butter in my coffee. For WAY less than twenty bucks. That's what it tastes like. Straight up coconut oil. I can't believe I wasted money on this product thinking it'd be high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Vegan life support!
customer_reviews.text: I’m vegan and I can’t imagine life without this stuff! I use it in my coffee, to make awesome cafe mocha, and the best chai ever. I wish it came cheaper in larger quantities because I use so much of it. If you can’t do dairy you must try this. It has a slightly sweet creamy flavor with a hint of coconut. So yummy! Instant craving buster and satisfies those between meal hunger pains. My favorite is the plain. The chocolate and turmeric are also good, but it’s easy to add cacao or turmeric to your beverage with the plain and maybe a couple drops of stevia to notch up the sweetness. Try adding cinnamon too!
customer_reviews.author: Momo

customer_reviews.title: Not rich and creamy
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a great alternative to diary. I added 1 HEAPING tbsp. of dried creamer and I could barely tell there was any creamer in my coffee, it also had only a faint hint of richness. I added another heaping tbsp. of the creamer and it finally changed the color of my cup of coffee and added some creaminess. But I was not adding 80 calories to my coffee and it was sweet since the creamer does have some sugar in it. I really wanted to like this product but I feel it just doesn't do what I hoped it would.
customer_reviews.author: waterlilly

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product does at it says. Although you should use a one handed electric blender, it keeps you full throughout the day because of it's ingredients. I use this as a creamer without sugar. I love this product and will use it for a very long time. It has all the natural nutrients and goes great with my coffee everyday. As you get older, it's important to use good ingredients for your health and this is one of them. I hope they sell it again in Costco, as the price is awesome. Since it was available on Amazon for a good price too, I bought it as I ran out of it. It is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Poipugirl

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing product.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to be great. It’s ok. For one thing I want my coffee to look like there’s cream in it (I have annoying allergy to casein). It doesn’t look creamy. I really wanted it to taste smooth and creamy. Nope not that either. It’s a “super food” that adds a bunch of calories but I couldn’t appreciate much flavor at all. So the search continues.
customer_reviews.author: avidreader59

customer_reviews.title: Dissolves easily in hot coffee but tastes like coconut
customer_reviews.text: The reason for the one-star review is that I despise the flavor of coconut mixed in coffee. Other reviewers indicated that there isn't really a noticeable coconut taste. I added one heaping teaspoon to approximately 6 oz. of hot coffee (automatically brewed, very dark Starbucks Sumatra roast), and the coconut flavor was overwhelming. I had to throw out the remaining liquid. I tried to add rice milk to the next cup and spooned in less powder, but it still tasted like coconut. Unlike other reviewers, I had no problem dissolving the fine powder in hot coffee. Maybe it is just an issue at lower temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: J. Toops

customer_reviews.title: Horrible taste and upset my stomach!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this, after reading the product description, thinking it would be a good addition to my coffee. Yuck! It altered the taste of my fine coffee to the point I couldn't even recognize it. I can't return it so I guess I will have to throw it away. Lesson learned. Thanks Laird.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality, great taste.
customer_reviews.text: So this product is really very good. I am always interested in what Laird gets into food wise. He got me hooked on Neuro 1 years ago. Like Laird or not, this is a great addition to the morning coffee. The ingredients appear to be smartly and sustainably sourced, and the quality is high. And I enjoy the taste immensely. For those with dietary restrictions, this is a very good additive to coffee provided coconut is permitted. Normally use hemp milk and this replaced it 100%. Normally add a scoop, add a shot of coffee, stir, add more coffee, stir and drink.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Give it a try?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I wanted a real milkless alternative to coffee creamer. I use creamer alone and wanted to like this so much because as a vegetarian and a healthy eater, this sounds perfect. It does taste good! But it just didn’t taste like it belongs in my coffee. It didn’t have that balance I was looking for and all I could taste was the coconut butter aftertaste. Which again wasn’t bad. But it’s just not a good coffee creamer alternative. No matter how much I added, it didn’t help.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Rose

customer_reviews.title: Ring around the cup, no 'creamer' impact.
customer_reviews.text: I'm used to a coffee creamer thinning out the harsh sharp flavor notes of fresh brewed coffee. This one has little or no flavor at all, and with 2T doesn't lighten the color of a cup. It does leave a rim of scum around the inside of the cup though that can take some pretty hard wiping to remove if like me, you let the cup sit a while before you port it to the kitchen for a little recycling. I don't mind the coconut flavor. The coarseness of the grind reminds me very much of little more than ground coconut "flour" -- which is far less expensive. No way will I be completing the bag, and I'm a skin-flint;-)
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C. Iman

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It makes creamy coffee for those who want to stay away from dairy. Yes, it doesn't mix smoothly, but if you're already familiar with butter coffee etc you've used a blender with your coffee and it's no biggee. Handy tip, I had one of those small, battery operated hand blenders that you get with some diet or protein powder drinks and that works well for mixing. The mocha version is pretty tasty too!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Aronson

customer_reviews.title: Creamy feel and taste
customer_reviews.text: Large bag should last a while and does not require refrigeration. This creamer at the recommended serving size (2 tsp) gave me a creamy feel and taste. Much fewer calories and much better flavor/feel than Coconut Cloud. I use a small whisk to stir it in, not sure how it would dissolve with just a spoon. This is a natural product, it is not bleached white like the other brands. It has a distinct coconut aroma, but I don't taste coconut as others have suggested. If you're looking for a healthy creamer and you are not adverse to coconut, this is your baby.
customer_reviews.author: Stellaj

customer_reviews.title: Zero Creamy Taste............NONE!
customer_reviews.text: Totally tasteless, doesn't mix well, and a waste of good money.... Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Mortensen

customer_reviews.title: Buy this if you want strong coconut flavor to hide your coffee
customer_reviews.text: Not good with espresso. Extremely strong 🥥 coconut flavor. Blends ok but didn't add any creaminess. Just sickening amount of coconut flavor and an odd sweetness. If you like the roast of your coffee bean you won't even recognize it after adding this. Maybe a tiny bit in 12 ounces of the cheapest drip coffee grind you can buy to give a hint of flavor because after adding this the choice of coffee beans is irrelevant. If you had hot caffeinated water and add this it would probably be the same result .. anyway it's a 10 dollar risk trying this since no returns... Good luck. Going in the trash unless I can figure out a use for this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Vespula

customer_reviews.title: It's a hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: I love that this is alternative to dairy creamer but as expected, it tastes way too strongly of coconut. I do not mind coconut but this is what you should expect if you are looking to purchase. I'm not sure why everyone expects their nondairy creamer to turn their coffee extremely light because IT NEVER WILL. This is still a pretty good creamer that adds some texture to your coffee. I can't say the coconut taste compliments every flavor of coffee however. It also will still have light clumps but a single heaping teaspoon mixed well for me. I think there will definitely be some days that I will not tolerate the taste since I'm not crazy for coconut.
customer_reviews.author: Dolly Buzz

customer_reviews.title: You've got to try this!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! I love the taste and the subtle sweetness. Problem is that it's actually very expensive considering 1# might last only 10 days. The creamer cost rivals my monthly coffee budget. Hence the 4 stat rating. Autoship price on 2# is tolerable. True, it does not actually lighten a cup of coffee very much so I use SoDelicious' liquid French Vanilla coconut creamer along with Laird's... Perfect taste plus balances out the overall cost.
customer_reviews.author: dm4220

customer_reviews.title: Ordered this figuring it would be good alternative to my 1/2 and 1/2 or bulletproof recipe
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this figuring it would be good alternative to my 1/2 and 1/2 or bulletproof recipe.I’ve tried several time and blended. I just cannot stomach the aftertaste (and I like coconut). Disappointed I spent the $ and it is not palatable.
customer_reviews.author: suziBee

customer_reviews.title: OMG! LOVE THIS CREAMER, HEALTHY, NO BLOATING!,
customer_reviews.text: This is the most AMAZING DELICIOUS, HEALTHY, NON BLOATING POWDER CREAMER EVER! I had to quit using half and half due to tummy bloating. It was a very DIFFICULT decision between nice creamed coffee in the morning or my WAISTLINE! I discovered this at a friends house. After tasting it, I decided to buy 2 bags even though it was $10 per bag/8oz. The ingredients in regular grocery store creamers is so so bad for you I wouldn’t drink it if you paid me. Thank you for this amazing product. Folks PLEASE BUY this so the manufacturer will lower the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Hostetler

customer_reviews.title: They are vegan and taste Amazing! Plus good for U!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE all of Lairds Superfood products! They taste amazing and truly elevate my green matcha tea lattes, smoothies & of course, Coffee- to another level. Anything i want to have a slightly creamier, denser richer flavor and be better for me nutritionally! They are a win/win‘! I cant drink my lattes without them anymore! Bothe the orig flavor & the tumeroc are excellent! They r on auto delivery for me w my prime account and I have purchased them for my siblings and friends, as well! Can not say enough positive things abt Lairds superfood creamers and products! Thank you Laurd for creating this stellar lineup of goodness & healthy alternative creamer choices!
customer_reviews.author: Booneflagrl

customer_reviews.title: Tastes great, but high in calories
customer_reviews.text: This tastes great and really enhances the coffee. I love coconut, so this really appeals to me.........BUT.......I didn't read the description well enough and didn't realize it was sweetened and is very high in calories. At the recommended amount of 2 tablespoons per cup, it's a whopping 90 calories being added to every cup and, for me, I still had to add a little more (lo-cal) creamer to my cup. That's disappointing. I may check out the unsweetened version, if I can get the nutritional information.
customer_reviews.author: ALai

customer_reviews.title: Yuck
customer_reviews.text: Cannot get used to this stuff. Not good tasting and hard to mix
customer_reviews.author: cin3dee

customer_reviews.title: If you only want a tiny bit of creamer in your coffee this is for you.
customer_reviews.text: So I was excited to get this creamer.... And then I used it as directed and of course one tablespoon isn't enough for a cup of coffee. I had to use 3-4 tablespoons and that's a lot of calories and a waste of money. Also it says that it's going to give you an energy boost of course I didn't get one. It does have great ingredients. If you only want a tiny bit of creamer in your coffee this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Elizabeth Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: Has to be doctored to get to 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: The product in coffee alone had a very strong coconut flavor and added no discernable smoothness or “creamer” feel/flavor, but I did like how I felt after drinking. I then discovered Nut Pods creamer. Now, I add equal parts of Laird and Nut Pods and have a creamy cup of coffee with only a slight waft of coconut that keeps me going all morning. Added bonus, i dont have any clumping isses this way, either.
customer_reviews.author: G Dobs

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Flavor, Doesn't Mix Well
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy the flavor of the Laird Hamilton creamer, but I don't recommend using it as a creamer for coffee. It does not mix well or dissolve, so you'll be left with a grainy feel in your coffee. I prefer to use this creamer for my oatmeal to add nutrients and a good coconut taste. Another good use is in smoothies. Some people might be put off with its consistency and call it chalky, but as long as you don't use the creamer with only a liquid you won't notice it in your food.
customer_reviews.author: Quincy C.

customer_reviews.title: Just OKAY.  Not liking the bitter aftertaste.
customer_reviews.text: It's okay as a non-dairy replacement coffee creamer. I brewed my coffee and added the Laird Superfood Coffee Creamer and coffee to my BlenTec mixer. So even though the product is clumpy it blends up nicely in my blender. I even added some MTC oil. At first sip, my coffee had a coconut creamy taste which is okay for me. It also added a hint of sweetness which I liked. But then it ends with a bitter aftertaste. So I will probably use it, not every day, but I do not plan on reordering.
customer_reviews.author: Vegan GMa

customer_reviews.title: Best unsweetened vegan creamer
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a vegan creamer for YEARS. I hate the Califa, Silk, Natural Bliss, Trader Joes, etc, etc. The only one I ever liked was Wildwood- and they discontinued it! But this creamer exceeded my expectations. It changes the mouth feel of the coffee and cuts the acidity without majorly altering the taste. It also mixes well, and the fact that I don't have to keep it in the fridge makes me sooo happy because it is very portable. Also, the price is so fair! I am very happy and I would recommend to anyone, but people who can't stand coconut may pick up on the slight coconut flavor and be unhappy with this.
customer_reviews.author: A. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Not so much!
customer_reviews.text: It tastes horrible! I had no trouble with lumps, just stir it in hot coffee, but it is absolutely disgusting. So sad that it is a complete loss for me. I had high hopes. It looks great, and the reviews I read made me think that it might be the answer for a dairy free, wholesome quality product. It is dairy free and it is wholesome, but yuck! Sorry, I just want to warn others.
customer_reviews.author: trishbooklover

customer_reviews.title: Blends well and I feel lighter
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed. Honestly, I’m not much of a coffee drinker but I’m trying really hard to be v.s my longtime vice of Monster energy drinks. Anyways, Laird is obviously the man so I found this product. Taste great and blends very well. I just put creamer in first, then coffee then a spoon. No clumps at all. Lastly, I think this creamer is to be credited for better BM. Sorry, but I think it’s true. Anyways, I’ll remain a customer. Hope to try the other flavors some day.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a natural creamer that has a good flavor this is a great product. I have tried the other "natural" creamers from the grocery store that are almond milk, soy milk, coconut milk based but they seem to give my coffee a watered down taste or the consistency isn't great. I like this one because it has a good flavor and does give a creaminess to my coffee that the others didn't. This also only has 1gram of sugar per serving! I found if you add it in hot coffee and immediately stir it generally does not get clumpy.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: Got this after flavcity kept recommending but if you add more than 1 -2 tsp in coffee it turns way too sour and doesn’t add enough of a creamy consistency to my coffee. I will stick with my Trader Joe’s soy creamer. Best non dairy alternative so far
customer_reviews.author: Karen V

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy it
customer_reviews.text: The bag is a tear open package. I supposed I can tear open it. After I tore the opening cut, it’s not open. I had to use scissors to cut it. Then this bag looks like it’s resealable. But that didn’t work either. I had to transfer the creamer to a bottle, resulted in a mess because the creamer is not powdery, the crumb fell all over. Also, the crumb looking creamer looks like expired product. The expiration date is on a sticker. It doesn’t taste like creamer. I didn’t return it because I didn’t want to go to UPS store at this quarantine time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tan

customer_reviews.title: does not blend and takes more product to taste
customer_reviews.text: **Revised, after using the product for a few days I have grown to really like the taste, it doesn't change the color of your coffee but it does enhance it tremendously and now I recommend if your trying to ween yourself off dairy. sounded promising with all the self promotion on social media but when you have to use more product that directed and then you have "shake or blend" hot coffee in order to attempt to blend = trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting and cuts bitterness.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's pricey, but if you can get over it not looking creamy with 2 teaspoons, the taste will convince you. I add a teaspoon of Organic sugar and honestly feel better after not using carageenan oil that's in the other creamers. Coffe is hotter, too, and I find I only drink two cups and feel satisfied. The only issue is they really need a better sealing option. For the price, a thicker strip seal should be used or a slider, because the powder keeps tge thin strip from closing. I put it inside a larger plastic baggie with a slider.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Bad taste and can't trust too much
customer_reviews.text: The power does not resolve into coffee well, although the ingredient looks healthy. You can see something is floating and falling in your coffee. It seems that they don't care packaging since you can't seal the bag. This makes you difficult to store it. This why I can't trust. Also you can't return it. Very bad experience!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: plain coffee drinker is enjoying it. You can still taste your coffee
customer_reviews.text: As a plain coffee drinker, this is good. This removes most coffee bitterness . It has a plain to slight cocunut oil taste and the coffee is creamier and smoother. I’m hoping that it will have some health benefits as well. I bought this based on the Laird reputation after stumbling upon link while looking for coffee on Amazon. If world class elite athletes think that this is a benefit to their health and they are willing to put their name on it, then it was worth a try for me. This does not hide your coffee’s flavor which is a plus for me.
customer_reviews.author: SCJr

customer_reviews.title: Gross!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is gross! Doesn't mix well and leaves clumps in the coffee. It changes the taste of the coffee and is super and sickly sweet. Tried it, gave it several chances and threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Of course I don't just eat random spoonfuls of this product! (ahem)
customer_reviews.text: I wanted not to like this product, crafted by the gorgeous world-famous surfer married to the gorgeous volleyball playing supermodel because HYPE. But damnit, this is product is too damn delectable. A spoonful for my coffee or smoothie or tea and then a few extra spoonfuls in my mouth because the taste is fab, swish, and delish. This one has coconut sugar, but isn't incredibly sweet, the unsweetened variety is also eat-out-of-the-bag delicious. No instagram photos for that lil' indulgence, burp.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: chalky flavored
customer_reviews.text: this product may be healthy, who really knows? how ever who is drinking coffee for there health . Lately coffee has been hard on my stomach so I thought I would try this product rather then half n half. well my opinion is its a non sweet chalky flavored product that keeps me from finishing my first cup of coffee in the morning I tried it 4 days and family members tried it once and no one liked it. wish i could return it.
customer_reviews.author: skkypilot

customer_reviews.title: This is actually very good!
customer_reviews.text: Having recently been advised by my naturopath to work toward becoming dairy, egg and sugar free, I was at a loss regarding how to make my coffee when away from home. I found individual packets of raw honey to carry in my purse but I cannot carry soy creamer around with me. I feel fortunate to have found this product as I can keep a small Tupperware container of it in my purse. And it actually tastes quite good and it doesn't require a lot to make my coffee creamy. Would be great to have single serving packets available to throw in my purse. I intend to try it in dairy and sugar free hot chocolate this coming winter.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Love, love love this creamer!
customer_reviews.text: Best vegan creamer I've found yet -- bonus is that I can mix it up in batches and not have to hope the grocery store has theirs in stock. Yes, it can look lumpy at first. But I put it in a bottle, add almond milk, cap it and then shake very vigorously. In the morning I just put some into my cup and microwave it to warm it up. When I add the hot water for my tea, not only are the lumps gone, but the cream is a bit frothy and creamy.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Malone

customer_reviews.title: Terrible bag container, doesn’t close. Flavor Too coconuty for me!
customer_reviews.text: I got the package yesterday and opened it up to put it in my coffee this morning, the powder was encrusted in the little teeth of the sealable bag, Making it really impossible to close, so now I have a lot of powder I can’t use in an unsealable bag. The flavor is good, a little too sweet for my taste and two coconuty, I mean, three out of four ingredients are coconut ha. I probably wouldn’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: teaman

customer_reviews.title: GREAT COFFEE CREAMER
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a coffee creamer that was non dairy and one that I could take on travel with me. I read the reviews and was very pleased so I ordered it. I was very delighted that it TASTED AMAZING in almost any coffee. I was able to travel with it and add it to my morning coffee. I have recommended it to many of my patients who are dairy intolerant and they love it !!
customer_reviews.author: AJ DeVere

customer_reviews.title: Love this creamer!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this creamer for a couple years now and I love it! It took me awhile to get used to it at the beginning because it is not like traditional powdered creamer.... I had to stop drinking coffee and I just had it stuck in my head what it was supposed to taste like. And this creamer and the Teechino coffee alternative took me awhile to get used to but now I wouldn't be without them! Habits are hard to break but this one was worth it for my health!
customer_reviews.author: ChelleBaby108

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I thought that I would try this product to replace my current creamer. However, after trying it, I am going to have to stick to my current creamer - HWC. I found that this creamer made my coffee bitter. I use fresh beans and grind my own coffee just before brewing. Maybe this creamer will work for others. It just didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: NOT A CREAMER
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful for this product based on the reviews. But, this does not “cream” your coffee. The packaging says Creamer and shows white coconut. Open the package and the content is brown. Needless to say, it did not change the appearance or taste of my coffee. And, it’s not returnable.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Canko

customer_reviews.title: This product is great!
customer_reviews.text: I love the energy energy I get form this amazing product. The ingredients are of highest quality and you can feel the boost it gives as soon as you start drinking. I blend it in my nutri bullet to really mix. The end result a frothy cappuccino style coffee. I add a little sweetener to it as the creamer itself is not sweet enough for myself. I want to get Lairds coconut sugar but you don’t have here on Amazon. But other than that I give this product thumbs up. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: MLR2005

customer_reviews.title: Love it - will buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product - where have you been all my coffee and smoothie life?!? I like the flavor - slightly coconut and while it a little clumpy it whisks well with one of those little hand held beverage whisks used for matcha tea and special coffees. Love it. Will buy again. Looking forward to trying Tumeric flavor. Expensive but well worth it and goes a long way! Rich in flavor but not overbearing - I didn't find it overtly coconut flavor - just right!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save your money..
customer_reviews.text: Used in coffee and tea. Terrible aftertaste, tastes like a superfood with no apology. My suggestion? Get your superfood another way and find something that lets you enjoy your morning beverage!
customer_reviews.author: Teri Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Healthy, but not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: This is the healthiest, simplest creamer I’ve ever come across. I was definitely expecting it to be like regular powder creamer in the sense of lightening the color of my coffee but it does not. It smells like yummy coconut right out of the bag but I can’t smell it once I put it in my coffee. For reference, the serving size is 3/4 of a TEAspoon and I use two full teaspoon amounts in one cup...still hardly anything taste wise.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Baca

customer_reviews.title: Not a great substitute if you’re looking for a half & half flavor
customer_reviews.text: Ugh. If you’re looking for something that tastes like half and half you’re looking at the wrong thing. This is bitter and has a weird aftertaste. I used a whisk to blend it into the coffee but it still came out a little clumpy. Shaking it cooled my coffee off so much that I had to put it in the microwave to re-heat. Would love to get the money back I just wasted on this ****
customer_reviews.author: M. Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Love Laird Superfood Coffee Creamers.
customer_reviews.text: I mistakenly purchased the Original Superfood Creamer and was upset with myself for not noticing. We usually purchase the unsweetened version. We were pleasantly surprised to discover that the original version is just lightly sweetened and is equally delicious. While I still prefer the unsweetened version, it was good to try the original so that we have something to compare with and can speak to the differences between these two great products. The Cacao Creamer is fantastic as well.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: It is what it is. Tastes like alomnda and coconuts if you put alot in. Does not make you drink white like milk. To me it was ok and did lump but disolved easily. Not buying again only because I don't like the strong favor. Good product though.
customer_reviews.author: BobESales

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: It took me a few times to really appreciate this product. You develop a fond taste for this product and you know it's healthy for you. It blends very well. No lumps. I enjoy the flavor it brings to the coffee. I have purchased a second bag.
customer_reviews.author: AMAZONQUEEN

customer_reviews.title: Tasty and not too sweet
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It has become my part of my morning staple. I mix it with my tea or coffee every morning. I love the flavor. It is not too sweet. It has a sweet aroma and does not overwhelm the taste of the coffee or tea. I am on my second bag now.
customer_reviews.author: Anoushig

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I am not a fan of the taste of this product. It does not dissolve easily. Also discovered that it gives me intestinal issues within about an hour of using it. I won't be purchasing more of this.
customer_reviews.author: J. Magdic

customer_reviews.title: It takes a heap of heapin’ teaspoons
customer_reviews.text: I was seeking an alternative to the chemical and fat-laden creamers in my office break room. This isn’t bad. It’s better than anything I’ve tried yet. A co-worker thought it was great. My only “complaint” is the recommended serving doesn’t come close to acting as a cream replacement in my coffee. For that I had to go 3-4 times the amount to get close. That makes it a little pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur H.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this product
customer_reviews.text: If you like coffee and you're into health and wellness then you found your new best friend. This product makes your coffee taste amazing and it adds additional health benefits along side it. It's so good I take some along with me to Starbucks when I don't make my brew at home. You really won't want to go without. My favorite flavor is the original. It mixes the best and in my opinion has the best flavor. Give your coffee a boost with Laird's Superfoods!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Failla

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, better alternative vendors.
customer_reviews.text: Product has good (not great) flavor, can be a challenge to fully dissolve in beverages, and am disappointed that Amazon is raising this along with other prices. Can be found significantly cheaper at other vendors on line.
customer_reviews.author: Person Use

customer_reviews.title: Makes coffee taste delicious, and is non dairy.
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff; cannot do without it. Makes coffee taste delicious. I always make sure I have an extra bag so I don't run out. I tried every non-dairy creamer out there and did not like any of them. Until I found this! It does have a faint coconut flavor but all of the non dairy creamers based on coconut oil have that; for me, I love it. I most often use Nutri bullet to make a foamy coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting
customer_reviews.text: The worst tasting product I have ever tried to use. Will never buy one again.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Good flavor, doesn't clump.
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend bought me this the first time and I like it so much I'm about to order it for the third time. There was a moment the very first time that I used it that I thought it's chunky powder would be clumpy in the coffee, but it all melts into coffee just fine. I've enjoyed coconut oil in my coffee for some time but Laird's mixture here is an upgrade from my usual 'bulletproof coffee'.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't get past the clumping that happens unless my ...
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get past the clumping that happens unless my coffee was piping hot. The taste and how it made my coffee more acidic started to bother me. I tried using it maybe 15 times and it just isn't for me. I will keep looking for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Mishka Haznor

customer_reviews.title: OMG... GOOD!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This blends so easily with my coffee and tastes amazingly good!!!!!! I finally found a non-dairy creamer that is healthy and exceeds all my taste expectations. I could eat this by the spoonful, except it's powder..... so I guess I'll just use it in my coffee instead!! Already placed my next order!
customer_reviews.author: NashGatorGirl

customer_reviews.title: If you don't like the taste of coconut don't try it.
customer_reviews.text: It taste too much like coconut and it didn't desolve well in coffee.
customer_reviews.author: veronica cox

customer_reviews.title: Every day.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this creamer for about a year now. I use it every day in my coffee with a bit of maple syrup to sweeten. I've also used it in smoothies, as well as a thickener for oatmeal. So tasty...I've considered giving up coffee, but I'd miss this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: CSVernon

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Overpower Coffee Flavor
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is the best. It has a great taste but doesn't overpower the coffee flavor. Plus all the other health benefits make it awesome. I highly recommend it for anyone looking to avoid dairy.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Flynn

customer_reviews.title: So tasty!
customer_reviews.text: A lovely nutritional addition to my coffee. Good fats are so important for your brain, and I have since been using this along with regular MCT oil, using a handheld milk frother to blend everything together to make a delightfully decadent frothy but healthy cup of coffee to enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Tried It

customer_reviews.title: Good Non-Dairy Powder Creamer w/Natural Ingredients
customer_reviews.text: This is a good non-dairy, non chemically substitute creamer, in a powder form. It’s slightly sweetened & made creamy with coconut milk. It’s not so sweet or creamy as to cover up the taste of good coffee. I use a whisk, which blends/dissolves it well into the hot coffee. This bag lasts me a month if not longer. I have it coming on autoship with 5+ other items, so I save 15% on the price, which is great!
customer_reviews.author: EKoons

customer_reviews.title: Questionable when buying from amazon
customer_reviews.text: This stuff was great when bought at Costco. When I bought it here it arrived hard as if moisture had been inside it even though I saw no holes. We. Still used it and didn’t get sick. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Ckdub

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is GREAT! Tasty and all natural ingredients. Yes, it has sugar so moderation is to be considered, but No white refined, artificial, high fructose, etc etc, absolutely toxic chemicals that are put in most products today. Great Quality! Great Taste!
customer_reviews.author: M Kathy King

customer_reviews.title: Taste awful
customer_reviews.text: This is not anywhere close to a creamer and taste awful. Very misleading to call this a creamer. I am a coffee drinker and was looking for a creamer to use instead of half & half. OMG! This is not even close. The awful powdered creamer in my office is much better than this. Also you cannot return this item. "This item isn't eligible for return"
customer_reviews.author: Rusiru Gunasena

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Creamer Alternative!!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure I'd like this so I started out with a small bag, first of all the smell is amazing and what it does for my tea is even better!!! ABSOLUTELY love this!!!! I have had no clumping issues etc... I will be buying more in the future!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra L. Houtz

customer_reviews.title: Smooth cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product, it taste good and dissolves nicely in your beverage. I like mine in my coffee, only thing I would say is you would really have to like the flavor of coconut (which I do) if not it's not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Tonia Esquilin Royal

customer_reviews.title: Ok for travel milk alternative
customer_reviews.text: This isn't too bad. I am allergic to milk and needed something for travel since regular restaurants do not carry milk alternatives. It has a strong flavor more than just coconut and vanilla. It took a LOT to make my coffee sweet enough to drink. I tried using with sugar but if you're not careful then it's way too sweet. It has a weird after taste. But I suppose you could get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Trinity

customer_reviews.title: Great taste
customer_reviews.text: I like to use hazelnut coffee creamer and this one taste great. I don't really notice a coconut flavor more of a nutty flavor to me. I like it. I feel like it has given me more energy!
customer_reviews.author: melissa a

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff, but...
customer_reviews.text: I really do like the flavor of this stuff and appreciate that it's sustain-ably produced and all that. My only complaints are that it seems like I need a LOT to adequately flavor even a regular sized cup of coffee, it doesn't mix particularly well, and despite the great flavor it doesn't really 'cream' or thicken the coffee the way a normal creamer would. Not really a big deal in the grand scheme of things. I'll still buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave V.

customer_reviews.title: Was skeptical at first but I really enjoy it!
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical due to some of the reviews but a friend of mine tried it and really enjoyed it, so I gave it a shot. This creamer is tastes great, is good for you, and now I'm a fan for sure! The power frother is definitely worth buying to use with these products also. It makes the clumping issue people talk about non existent. Only reason for 4 stars is it's a little pricey for creamer, but overall a good product and worth trying out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is YUMMY
customer_reviews.text: What a pleasant surprise. I like my coffee light, so I will go through the bag quickly. The product was very smooth and stayed mixed. Delicious- auto delivery!
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to normal store creamers that are full of ...
customer_reviews.text: The taste of this creamer is somewhat invisible, but it does what it's supposed to do. It's a lot chunkier than the cacao flavor (tried that one first) and is hard to mix in. I've started to put it in with the instant coffee, or in the cup before I pour the coffee, and it seems to help a bit. Good alternative to normal store creamers that are full of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S.

customer_reviews.title: Just for hot coffee
customer_reviews.text: I think this is best used for hot coffee and not iced coffee. I tried blending it in a ninja when mixing my iced coffee and it just clumped. It doesn’t taste too bad in hot coffee, but That’s it.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Natural, does not make your coffee taste like coconut, creamy and fairly priced for the benefits received.
customer_reviews.text: I was using the CoffeeMate Creamer. From my 1st use of Laird Coffee Creamer I was hooked! It is creamy, tastes great and it is natural. You will likely need to experiment with how much to add to your coffee but believe me, you will be oh so glad that you made the switch!
customer_reviews.author: MsPurrple

customer_reviews.title: LOVED THE CREAMER
customer_reviews.text: We have a coffee club at work. I am in charge of it. We are big powder creamer crew. And uses so much powder in our coffee. I read an article that we are putting pure chemical in our coffee. So I researched it out. I found all the different brands have the same ingredients. I looked for organic creamer and came across this brands. The girls love it. They finally are experiencing the coffee with cream instead of cream in coffee. We paired it up with raw sugar. We don't use as much. Now we feel we are drinking coffee more healthy. Thanks for this creamer. Will signing for subscription.
customer_reviews.author: Cyberqueen21

customer_reviews.title: Great ingredient list but this coffee creamer doesn't dissolve in coffee
customer_reviews.text: Seems to have a lot of quality ingredients, but like other reviewers, I grew tired of stirring and stirring, only to see clumps in my coffee. You would think that someone concerned about providing a quality coffee creamer would make sure the stuff dissolves in coffee! Guess not, I threw most of mine out.
customer_reviews.author: John Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Wrong one sent
customer_reviews.text: Received the wrong one and there's no method of returning it! So disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Raechelle

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good. I like plant milk better though. Would have given 5 stars if there was no palm oil used in it and it didn't leave oily feeling on lips like you ate pizza. Also hard to mix completely. I think this is better in smoothies than used as covfefe creamer.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Not a creamer.
customer_reviews.text: This "creamer" does not cream. It lumps and clumps. I've tried shaking, stirring, beating, and frothing. Short of splitting atoms I dont think this "creamer" will blend. Buy at your own risk. You have been warned.
customer_reviews.author: LADrew

customer_reviews.title: ... the right amount of flavor and a hint of sweetness. If you want to just "cut" your black ...
customer_reviews.text: Adds just the right amount of flavor and a hint of sweetness. If you want to just "cut" your black coffee with something this is perfect and healthy as well.
customer_reviews.author: LaSalle

customer_reviews.title: COCONUT YUMMNESSSS!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you love coconut flavor ( cause it is strong) THIS IS THE BEST product for you! IT IS FOR ME! Glad I have tried it. Guaranteed repeat customer. Melts well. No need to wisk at my end. I simply stirr it and it Melts right away and it feels like a TREAT every time I use it. Hard to believe the low calories this product has 🙃 YUMMMM !!!
customer_reviews.author: Smarty ;-P

customer_reviews.title: delicious. does better with a blender
customer_reviews.text: great with my coffee... I use a tiny blender to mix it up and ends up frothy, creamy. delicious. it didn't do so well with a spoon...
customer_reviews.author: Coby phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great natural creamer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this creamer. I am getting ready to order my 3rd bag. My husband has also decided he loves it, do maybe i better get 2. It has a light coconut flavor and just a little sweeteness. Very natural flavor. I have found that after using this, other creamers are to sweet. I even keep some on me for when we are out.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Maybe not
customer_reviews.text: I love this creamer. I won't buy it here again because I did not read the quantity for the price. I usually buy 2lb bags for less than the 1lb bag was from here.
customer_reviews.author: Oshh

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for traveling
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to take with me on the road and it mixed just fine, no different then any other powdered creamer. Mixed with frother when home it was even better. I loved the subtle coconut/scent and flavor. Very very subtle so don’t let that persuade you if you don’t like flavors. It was not sweet, which was perfect for me. I’m curious to try the unsweetened version. Great product & im going to
customer_reviews.author: Maria C.

customer_reviews.title: Above and Beyond
customer_reviews.text: I was shopping for a vegan alternative for coffee creamer to modify my grandma’s hot cocoa recipe. This product works great! The fact that it has superfoods is a huge bonus.
customer_reviews.author: HS

customer_reviews.title: Great substitute
customer_reviews.text: The flavor is a good pairing with coffee. I haven't used it anything else but it mixes well and does seem to give you a bit of longer lasting energy.
customer_reviews.author: N. Gonzalez

product_meta.title: Laird Superfood Coffee Creamer Vegan Original 1 lb
feature_bullets: PLANT-BASED COFFEE CREAMER POWDER - Original non refrigerated coffee creamer; shelf-stable powdered creamer infused with beneficial minerals; Dairy-Free, Gluten-Free, Vegan, Soy Free & Non-GMO
SUPERFOOD NOURISHMENT - Laird Superfood Creamers are crafted from the highest quality all-natural whole food ingredients & sustainably sourced for delicious powder coffee creamer
NO FILLERS OR ADDITIVES - Laird's Dry Coffee Creamers contain NO sugar additives, artificial ingredients, sweeteners, artificial colors, & chemicals
CLEAN KETO CREAMER - Superfood creamer made with Coconut Milk Powder, Organic Coconut Sugar, Aquamin (Calcified Marine Algae), Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil
DIRECTIONS - Add 2 tablespoons to coffee or mix to taste | Simply massage bag to break up contents before use

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
